title: CoHabit Mobile Application Design
longSummary: CoHabit is a roommate-matching concept focused on helping students find compatible roommates and manage shared living tasks. The project includes user flows for onboarding, roommate matching by interests and habits, chore scheduling, and an in-app messaging experience. Emphasis was placed on accessibility, clear information architecture, and mobile-first interactions.
responsibilities: Conducted user research and persona creation
Designed wireframes and high-fidelity mobile prototypes
Built interactive prototypes to validate onboarding and matching flows
Worked on accessibility checks and iterative usability testing

title: StarFish Redesign
longSummary: A full visual and interaction redesign for StarFish, a student resource platform. The redesign focused on improving discoverability of services, reducing cognitive load, and enhancing responsiveness across devices. Changes included updated typography, clearer CTAs, and improved navigational patterns to help students access resources faster.
responsibilities: Performed heuristic evaluations and accessibility audits
Created redesigned UI components and system tokens
Prototyped key flows and validated with users
Collaborated with devs to implement accessible markup and responsive styles

title: DishDive Website
longSummary: DishDive is a recipe-sharing website built with plain HTML, CSS and JavaScript. The project focused on a clean, image-forward layout and interactive features for browsing, commenting and rating dishes. It includes responsive grid layouts, filtering, and user-friendly forms for adding recipes.
responsibilities: Designed and implemented responsive layouts
Built interactive filtering and rating UI with vanilla JavaScript
Optimized images and lazy-loading for faster page loads
Implemented accessible forms and keyboard navigation

title: LawBandit Home UI Redesign
longSummary: A UX research-driven case study that examined pain points on a legal education platform. The work produced wireframes, low- and high-fidelity prototypes, and recommended interaction patterns to help learners find content and track progress more effectively.
responsibilities: Conducted user research and mapped user journeys
Created wireframes and interactive prototypes
Documented design decisions and accessibility considerations

title: Badger Mart
longSummary: Badger Mart is an AI-assisted campus marketplace concept for students to list, buy and sell items. The project explored search and discovery features, mobile-first checkout flows, and product listing patterns to support quick posting and fair matching between buyers and sellers.
responsibilities: Designed product listing and search interfaces
Prototype mobile-first posting and checkout flows
Iterated on pattern library elements for consistency

title: LPHIE Madison Chapter Website Redesign
longSummary: A full website rebuild for the Lambda Phi Epsilon Madison chapter to modernize the look, improve responsiveness, and better promote events and recruitment. The site includes responsive templates, event listings, and contact forms tailored to the chapter's needs.
responsibilities: Built responsive templates and event pages
Improved content structure for recruitment and alumni engagement
Worked with chapter stakeholders to iterate on content and visuals
